page.title: 09SPINNING AND WEAVING
page.content: Milland Farm is a centre for spinning and weaving. To produce the wool a small flock of mixed and rare sheep is kept and bred - Dorset, Black Welsh, Jacob, Suffolk X and Shetland. These produce wool ranging in colour from dark brown to grey to pale brown and white. A carding machine has been acquired from an old Devon tweed mill and re-assembled so that the whole process from carding the fleece through spinning and dyeing to knitting the finished garment or weaving the material or carpet can be done on the premises. Courses are held throughout the year for weaving, spinning, dyeing and knitting and a monthly workshop is held for local spinners and weavers.
